Package main

Class MasterMind

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.MasterMind
  • public class MasterMind
extends java.lang.Object
    Core requirement of MasterMind is implemented in this class.
    See Also:
    has the jdbc driver to establish connection with MySQL., includes the "main" method to run the application, start(), play(), readUserInput(), calculate(int[] computerGeneratedNumbers, int[] userGuess), result(int counter), isPlayAgain(String response), resetHistory(), (), getFeedbackFromArray()

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start()
        Starts the game by asking the user's name and saves it at global scope, then calls play() method to start the actual logic.
        See Also:
        play()

      • play

        public void play()
        Play starts the initial core logic of the game. It asks for user's input, generates random numbers, calls the calculate(int[] a, int[] b) method and change the value of iSWin and numberOfAttempts.
        See Also:
        calculate(int[], int[]), isWin, numberOfAttempts, isPlayAgain(String), result(int), getGuessHistory()

      • chooseDifficultyLevel

        public void chooseDifficultyLevel()
        chooseDifficultyLevel method asks the user for difficulty level then it sets the RandomGenerator's API to generate one of the followings. 1 will generate an array with 4 random values. 2 will generate 6 elements and 3 will generate 8 elements. It also decreases the number attempts from 10 to 8, 6 and 5. It makes it harder.
        See Also:
        generateRandomNumbers(), difficultyLevelValue

      • generateRandomNumbers

        public int[] generateRandomNumbers()
        It makes a get request to generate random numbers. The size of the request is impacted by
        See Also:
        chooseDifficultyLevel()

      • readUserInput

        public int[] readUserInput()
        ReadeUserInput accepts user's input then validates. If the number is wrong, the allows the user to re-enter.
        Returns:
        #convertStringToArrayOfInteger(String userGuess) first converts the user's input then returns an array of integers.
        See Also:
        convertStringToArrayOfInteger(String)

      • isValid

        private boolean isValid​(java.lang.String userGuess)
        isValid accepts a string input then converts to integer, and it also validates the domain for the input values. If digits are less 0 (negative) and greater than (9), return false, and if userInput's guess length doesn't match the computer the chosen difficulty level, it returns false.
        Parameters:
        userGuess - is a string value entered by the user as an input.
        Returns:
        if length and values are not valid, it returns false.

      • convertStringToArrayOfInteger

        private int[] convertStringToArrayOfInteger​(java.lang.String data)
        ConvertStringToArrayOfInteger accepts string and returns an array of integers.
        Parameters:
        data - userInput
        Returns:
        a new array.

      • calculate

        public int calculate​(int[] computerGeneratedNumbers,
                     int[] userGuess)
        Calculate accepts two arrays, one randomNumbers generated by the computer and the converted userGuess. It then compares both by indices. If exact value matches an exact index, then it increments @Field #guessedCorrectAndNumberLocation, it only increments when two values at exact indices match in the two arrays. If the first case fails, then it tries to find a exact number in the randomGenerated list. It increments @Field #guessedCorrectNumber, when a value doesn't have an exact position match but still exist in the list. Exact digit and index position has precedence over others. The first match has precedence over second math. It is only match with one value, if there are two {1,1}, {1,2}, only the first correct match increments.
        Returns:
        integer correct guess with correct index location which determines if a player wins/loses the game.
        See Also:
        play(), (), (), (), writeFeedbackIntoDB(HashMap), () writes in the RAM memory., ()

      • result

        public java.lang.String result​(int counter)
        Result displays the number of attempts it took the player to win.
        Parameters:
        counter - just keep record of the while loop.
        Returns:
        "You Won! in " + (counter) + " attempts";

      • isPlayAgain

        private void isPlayAgain​(java.lang.String checkResponse)
        IsPlayAgain asks the user to make a decision after winning or losing the game. The choices are: Do you want to play again? Do you want to check the history for input and feedback output? It also retrieves the history from the database where it displays the result and feedback from other players.
        Parameters:
        checkResponse - pass three strings 1. yes, 2. history, 3. no. Based on these the method decides where to lead the user.
        See Also:
        play()

      • hint

        private int[] hint​(int[] array)
        Hint triggers when a play can't win in 3 guesses, then it gives a feedback for the minimum and maximum values to help the user.
        Parameters:
        array - accepts an array and returns the min and max values.
        Returns:
        an array with two indices a[0] = min, a[1] = max. The only purpose for this return is to test the function.

      • resetHistory

        private void resetHistory()
        ResetHistory, resets the history when a player wins then tries to play again, therefore, the following variables are affected with this method.
        See Also:
        play(), isPlayAgain(String)
